definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
lit. to cut all at one stroke (idiom); to impose uniformity/one solution fits a diversity of problems/one size fits all
(of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack

sentences.english: She ordered gummi bears and a knife a couple hours ago.
sentences.chinese: 几小时前预定了一些小熊软糖和一把刀。

sentences.english: Suddenly the hero's son picked up a knife and killed the dragon.
sentences.chinese: 突然英雄的儿子拿起刀杀了龙。

sentences.english: This special blade on his knife is for picking stones out of horses' feet.
sentences.chinese: 他刀上有一特制刀刃，是用来剔去马蹄上的石头的。

sentences.english: Don't leave the sharp knife where our little Jane can get it.
sentences.chinese: 不要把这把锋利的刀放在我们小简可能会够到的地方。

sentences.english: Then using a special knife, they cut off the lids of the cells.
sentences.chinese: 用一种特殊的刀，刮下蜂板上的覆盖层。

sentences.english: A man, like a sword, rusts in idleness.
sentences.chinese: 刀不用会生锈，人闲着会怠惰。

sentences.english: They raised the pirate flag, with its picture of a skull and crossed bones.
sentences.chinese: 他们升起海盗旗，上面画着骷髅头和交叉的两把刀。

sentences.english: Experts agreed it was possible Mr Putin had gone under the knife.
sentences.chinese: 专家一致认为普京是动过刀了。

sentences.english: Catching each other's eyes glinting in the night, they held their cane knives and machetes with tight fists.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的眼里都闪着光芒，双拳紧握甘蔗刀和大刀。

sentences.english: The magnificent Orion Nebula, or M42, is a fuzzy patch in Orion's Sword.
sentences.chinese: 美丽的猎户座星云和M42就是猎人手中的那把刀。

sentences.english: A charlatan murders without a knife.
In China it is rare to see a knife on the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，餐桌上放一把刀是极其少见的现象。

sentences.english: They heard the clash of swords.
She ran at me with a knife in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着刀向我冲来。

sentences.english: The gap between crushing blade and sieve can be adjusted.
sentences.chinese: 粉碎刀与筛网间隙可调。

sentences.english: The baker, who was the proprietor in person, took up a loaf and a knife.
sentences.chinese: 那卖面包的便是店主人，他拿起了一个面包和一把刀。

definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
